messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., "Peter McEvoy" <pmcevoy@i...> wrote:
> Dave,
> Thanks for getting back on this. I will try it over the next few
days - however I'm wondering why
> tearDown wasn't in a finally block in the first place? Was it a
design descision or just an error?

Pete,

My guess is that someone wanted to keep the system state around if the
test failed. I tend to use this class to set up and clean up
databases, and can see the value of doing it both ways.

Looks like some people are saying this isn't a problem at all, on
another thread. I'll run my tests to see if they're right.

Dave
